message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.CY, cs.GT, cs.IT 

The paper discusses the use of zero-knowledge proof of identity and its application to permissionless blockchains, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). It also touches upon the scalability trilemma and consensus protocols, which are topics related to distributed computing (cs.DC). The use of national identity cards and ePassports also involves cryptography (cs.CY). The paper also discusses Nash equilibrium and game theory, which falls under the category of theoretical computer science (cs.GT). Finally, the paper mentions lower infrastructure costs and network effects, which are related to information theory (cs.IT).
